com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api
Class GEView

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.GEView

public class GEView
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

Controls the behavior of the camera that views the scene in Google Earth.

Author:
Nick

Method Detail

project

public final KmlVec2 project(double lat,
                             double lng,
                             double alt,
                             KmlAltitudeMode altitudeMode)
Returns the screen x,y coordinates of a given point on the globe. Tip: project() is the inverse of hitTest().

Parameters:
lat -
lng -
alt -
altitudeMode -
Returns:
Returns a KmlVec2 object defining the current coordinates of a geographic point, or null if the lat/lng/alt is not currently on screen. Tip: project() is the inverse of hitTest().

setAbstractView

public final void setAbstractView(KmlAbstractView view)
Sets the camera that views the scene in Google Earth.

Parameters:
view -

copyAsLookAt

public final KmlLookAt copyAsLookAt(KmlAltitudeMode altitudeMode)
Creates and returns a new KmlLookAt object, initialized to the current camera position and orientation. Use 'altitudeMode' to specify the altitude mode of the looked-at point.

Parameters:
altitudeMode -
Returns:
Creates and returns a new KmlLookAt object, initialized to the current camera position and orientation. Use 'altitudeMode' to specify the altitude mode of the looked-at point.

copyAsCamera

public final KmlCamera copyAsCamera(KmlAltitudeMode altitudeMode)
Creates and returns a new KmlCamera object, initialized to the current camera position and orientation. Use 'altitudeMode' to specify the altitude mode of the new camera.

Parameters:
altitudeMode -
Returns:
a new KmlCamera object, initialized to the current camera position and orientation. Use 'altitudeMode' to specify the altitude mode of the new camera.

getViewportGlobeBounds

public final KmlLatLonBox getViewportGlobeBounds()
Returns a bounding box that completely contains the region of the globe that is currently visible. The returned box will be larger than what is strictly visible, if that is necessary to include everything that is visible.

Returns:
Returns a KmlLatLonBox corresponding to the bounding box of the current viewport or null if no part of the globe is visible.

hitTest

public final GEHitTestResult hitTest(float x,
                                     KmlUnits xUnits,
                                     float y,
                                     KmlUnits yUnits,
                                     GEHitTestMode... mode)
Given a point on the screen in pixel coordinates, returns a GEHitTestResult with information about the geographic location corresponding to the point on the screen. Tip: hitTest() is the inverse of project().

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate, measured from the left or right edge of the plug-in window, depending on xUnits.
xUnits - The units in which the x value is specified.
y - The y coordinate, measured from the top or bottom edge of the plug-in window, depending on yUnits.
yUnits - The units in which the y value is specified.
mode - Selects which categories of objects to include in the hit test.
Returns:
Returns a GEHitTestResult, or null if the screen point is not over anything selected by mode. Note that for HIT_TEST_GLOBE, resulting altitude values will always be 0.

addViewChangeListener

public final com.google.gwt.event.shared.HandlerRegistration addViewChangeListener(ViewChangeListener listener)
Register a listener to be notified when the view is changed

Parameters:
listener - The listener to be notified when the view is changed
Returns:
The HandlerRegistration that can be used to unregister the listener
